uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.charts

Class Chart<P extends Plot>

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.AbstractContexed
      • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.charts.Chart<P>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Contexed
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PeriodChart, PieChart, ScatterPeriodChart

    public abstract class Chart<P extends Plot>
extends AbstractContexed
    Chart is a base class for chart generation. Its essentially a facade class around underlying implementation classes (that implement the ChartData interface) to allow the underlying chart package to be swapped in and out. Useful helper methods that only use the public ChartData interface can live in the Chart object. The data within a chart is represented by an object implementing the SetPlot interface that is generated by the ChartData.

    Sub-classes of Chart have correspondng sub-lcasses of ChartData and SetPlot.

    The data model is that data is classified into categories/sets. Each set is plotted separately for example as different lines, sectors of a pie-chart or bars on a bar-chart. Charts also support a set of text legends that label the sets.

        public final void sortSets(SetPlot p,
                           double other_frac)
        Sort the sets of Dataset largest first with small sets mapped to an others category
        Parameters:

      • sortSets

        public final void sortSets(SetPlot p,
                           double other_frac,
                           int max_plot)
        Sort the sets of Dataset largest first with small sets mapped to an others category the legends for the plots are also permuted. A plot with multiple datasets added may have additional legends so we assume the legends for this dataset are at the end.
        Parameters:
        other_frac - fraction of total plot below which a set is mapped to the Others catagory
        max_plot - maximum number of sets to show including Others. zero implies no limit.

      • sortSets

        public final void sortSets(SetPlot p,
                           int max_plot)
        Sort the sets of Dataset largest first with small sets mapped to an others category
        Parameters:
        max_plot - maximum number of sets to show including Others. zero implies no limit.
